turns.content: Can you recommend any good seafood restaurants in Boston, Massachusetts?

I cannot have personal preferences or make recommendations. however, here are some top-rated seafood restaurants in boston according to tripadvisor:

1. neptune oyster
2. island creek oyster bar
3. b&g oysters
4. row 34
5. legal sea foods
6. atlantic fish company
7. yankee lobster company
8. james hook & co.
9. the daily catch
10. select oyster bar.
Wow, those all sound like great options! Can you tell me which one has the best lobster roll? I'm a huge fan of those.

Many people regard Neptune Oyster as having the best lobster roll in Boston. However, some other popular options for lobster rolls include Row 34, James Hook & Co., and B&G Oysters. It would be best to try a few and see which one suits your taste preferences the best!
Can you tell me which of these seafood restaurants is the most affordable? I would like to try a lobster roll but I am on a limited budget.

I cannot provide exact pricing for restaurants. however, some of the lesser expensive seafood restaurants in boston (including options for lobster rolls) are:

1. james hook & co.
2. yankee lobster company
3. barking crab
4. alive and kicking lobsters
5. the daily catch

again, it is best to check these seafood restaurants' prices for lobster rolls on their menus or website to ensure it fits your budget.
Hmm, I think I want to try the lobster roll at James Hook & Co. Do they offer any sides or drinks with it? Also, do I need to make a reservation or can I just walk in?

James Hook & Co. offers sides such as coleslaw, clam chowder, and potato salad which you can add to your order. As for drinks, they offer soda and bottled water. There's no information on whether they serve alcoholic beverages or not.

Regarding reservations, James Hook & Co. is a takeout spot, and it doesn't require a reservation. You can just walk in and place your order for a lobster roll.

I'm really excited to try the lobster roll at James Hook & Co. Do you think it's best to eat it there or take it to go? I heard they have a great outdoor seating area, but I'm not sure if it will be too crowded.

James Hook & Co. is a takeout spot, and they don't provide any indoor or outdoor seating areas for their customers. So, if you want to enjoy your lobster roll at James Hook & Co., you will have to eat it on their nearby benches or find a spot in the surrounding park or waterfront area. However, if you're worried about crowds or prefer a more comfortable seating area, you can take your lobster roll to go and eat it somewhere else. Boston has several parks and picnic areas, such as Boston Common or the Esplanade, where you could enjoy your lobster roll.

That sounds like a great plan! I'll definitely take my lobster roll to go and find a nice spot to enjoy it. Thank you for all of your help in recommending the best seafood restaurants in Boston and giving me all the important details about James Hook & Co. I can't wait to try it out!
You're welcome! I hope you enjoy your visit to James Hook & Co., and your lobster roll is absolutely delicious. If you need any further assistance or have any more questions, don't hesitate to ask.
